Evidentiary Harpoon.definition: evidence consisting esp. of a police officer's statement that is improper and is knowingly offered by the prosecution to prejudice the defendant in the eyes of the jury
Evidentiary Harpoon.origin: [from the comparison of such evidence to a harpoon, which can be retracted after it has injured its target]

1.1: evidence consisting esp. of a police officer's statement that is improper and is knowingly offered by the prosecution to prejudice the defendant in the eyes of the jury
